introduction: The Organic Chemistry Virtual Lab provides an immersive and interactive platform for students and faculty to explore core experiments in organic chemistry through a digital medium. These virtual simulations replicate real-world laboratory procedures, offering a safe, accessible, and pedagogically effective environment to enhance conceptual understanding and practical skills. The lab encompasses a wide range of foundational and advanced experiments, from qualitative analysis and purification techniques to synthesis and spectroscopic estimation, fostering an integrated approach to learning organic chemistry.

experiments.name: Separation of Compounds Using Column Chromatography
Calculation of maximum wavelength of Organic Compounds Using Woodward Fieser Rules

UG: B.Sc. Chemistry, B.Tech./B.E. (Chemical Engineering, Materials Science, EEE, ECE, Mechanical, Civil)
PG: MS/Ph. D. Beginners in Chemical Science

objective:
• To enable students to perform essential organic chemistry experiments through a simulated, interactive environment.
  • To develop analytical and observational skills through the detection of elements and functional groups using virtual tests.
  • To provide experiential learning in purification and separation techniques like distillation and chromatography.
  • To strengthen understanding of reaction mechanisms through guided organic synthesis tasks.
  • To familiarize students with instrumentation and spectral estimation methods, including Î»max calculations and laser photometry.
  • To support faculty in demonstrating complex procedures safely and repeatedly for deeper pedagogical impact.
  • To bridge the gap between theoretical instruction and laboratory practice in resource-constrained educational settings.
